Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: There are several sustainable and environmental practices mentioned throughout the provided information. Cartograph Winery has committed to creating the best wine with minimal environmental impact by using resources from the land and treating social and environmental impact as a primary measure of success. They also donate 1% of their gross revenues to environmental organizations. In addition, they have partnered with ReCORK to recycle natural corks from their tasting room, which replaces harmful petroleum-based materials. Finally, they are currently redesigning their website to reduce excessive text content and replace it with visual storytelling.

source.content: As stewards of the land we seek to create the best wine with the smallest impact on the environment while inspiring social responsibility within our company and providing joy to our guests We seek to create a sustainable company that creates the best product as we can in an environment to inspire joy social and environmental responsibility  We treat our social and environmental impact as a primary measure of success for our business and prioritize it even in cases where it may not drive profitability We make wine from the resources we get from the land and we want to give back to help protect it 1 for the Planet’s mission is to bring dollars and doers together to accelerate smart environmental giving 1 of our gross revenues directly benefit qualified environmental not-for-profits Each time you buy a bottle of wine from Cartograph you’re helping the environment Our hope is that together we’ll leave the world a better place  Certified B Corporations are businesses that meet the highest

July is really our last month to finish projects and focus on non-harvest tasks — because once August hits and harvest kicks in everything else becomes secondary or tertiary While we have time let us tell you about a few new things coming down the pike We’re delighted to announce that we’ve partnered with ReCORK to recycle our tasting-room corks Every month we send our used natural corks to ReCORK; they grind the corks and use them to make cool products like shoe soles and yoga blocks — replacing harmful petroleum-based materials such as foam and plastic If you live in or around Healdsburg and would like to bring in your natural corks for recycling we’re happy to include them in our shipments No synthetic corks please You know that we’re nerds who love to tell stories…so there was a lot of text on the Cartograph website Too much actually We’ve spent the past year trying to translate text into photos and soon we’ll be unveiling Phase One of our new website Those of you who use your

with people and tell the Cartograph story Plus we’re hearing that people enjoy the opportunity for more focused education and the chance to ask in-depth questions about how wine is made and aged Alan kicked off his Inside Pinot tasting series in January; it was fun to see how tasters responded to the juice and fermentation samples and compared them to the finished wine We’ll soon be adding several more Inside Pinot dates to our events calendar We’ve applied the small-group concept to our monthly Winemaker Tastings at the tasting room with participation limited to 10 people so the tastings are more educational and conversational We’re excited for the next tasting a Perli Vineyard Vertical this month In February we participated in the International Alsace Varietals Festival in Mendocino County which offered a great series of seminars and a tasting from a group of about 30 wineries that focus on grapes grown in the Alsace region of France We poured our  Gewürztraminer  Gewürztraminer and

a gallery that documents some of the fun We have a number of exciting events coming up this summer June  We’ll offer a special tasting at the Cartograph tasting room during the annual Russian River Valley Passport July 11 Alan’s winemaker tasting focuses on a four-year vertical from Perli Vineyard — a rare treat because we’re officially sold out of the  Perli Pinot but we held back several cases for this event July 18 Cartograph Circle members will enjoy special benefits at more than 30 tasting rooms in downtown Healdsburg during the fourth annual Wine’d Up Circle members are club members for the day at all the participating downtown tasting rooms For Circle members outside of Healdsburg certain tasting rooms will offer club discounts that day on phone and web orders If you register on Eventbrite use the Cartograph Circle promotion code contact Serena for the code July 24–26 We wrap up the month in McMinnville Ore where we’ll be pouring at the International Pinot Noir Celebration

Eventbrite use the Cartograph Circle promotion code contact Serena for the code July 24–26 We wrap up the month in McMinnville Ore where we’ll be pouring at the International Pinot Noir Celebration We’re excited to catch up with Circle members there and to share our wines with Pinot enthusiasts August 8 We have one last winemaker tasting scheduled around harvest time It will be a Floodgate Vineyard Vertical with Pinots from  -  Once late summer/early fall roll around we’ll be spending a lot of time in the vineyards During harvest we’ll bring grapes into the tasting room for sampling and will set up fermentations on the bar so you can follow along with what’s happening to the juice Between picks in September we’ll get the fall release shipped out to our Circle members and celebrate the new wines with a party in Healdsburg details and date TBD Watch for the next series of winemaker tastings and Inside Pinot sessions on the calendar starting in November If you’re interested in vineyard

However, it is mentioned that they aim to create a sustainable company that makes the best product possible using local resources, treating social and environmental impact as a primary measure of success, and making efforts to protect the environment. Based on these statements, it can be inferred that they track and report metrics related to resource usage, waste reduction, carbon footprint, and philanthropic contributions towards environmental causes.

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Has the organization made any public commitments to social or corporate responsibility?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, the organization has made several public commitments to social and corporate responsibility. They have pledged to create a sustainable company that produces the best wines possible while minimizing their environmental impact. Additionally, they prioritize social and environmental responsibility even if it doesn't drive immediate profits. The organization also contributes a portion of their gross revenues to qualified environmental non-profit organizations. Furthermore, they are certified as a B Corporation, which means they adhere to strict social and environmental performance standards, practice transparency, and hold themselves legally accountable for balancing profit and purpose. Lastly, they actively participate in fire recovery efforts and support local community wellness initiatives, such as the Community Wellness Center and programs focused on mental health and bilingual clinicians.

pipeline they support and the focus on bilingual clinicians is critical in this community As is the Community Wellness Center initiative It’s a big deal for everyone to feel that there is a place for them—a place where they can feel safe a place they can trust where they can build community We know what isolation has done to us over the last few years  healthcarefoundationnet When the pandemic hit in spring  we worried about hunger and how people were going to access food Realizing that the pandemic was going to create even more issues related to hunger and health we partnered with the Redwood Empire Foodbank Our team has paid time to volunteer for the food bank and we provide a significant donation every year

fire-recovery efforts Cartograph joined many other Sonoma County businesses to help people affected by the fires and we continue to look for ways to assist those who are trying to rebuild At the same time we believe the arts serve the community by bringing people together for a shared joyous experience — so as we thought about gathering people around something positive we reached out to the Green Music Center to form a partnership  We deeply believe in the impact of a community to support itself and it's wellness when it has access to services and clinicians that are community based and culturally aware A healthy community is a strong community We love that the Healthcare Foundation provides numerous grants that focus on these communities and clinicians In particular the mental health pipeline they support and the focus on bilingual clinicians is critical in this community As is the Community Wellness Center initiative It’s a big deal for everyone to feel that there is a place for

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: What community or social events have been organized to fulfill these commitments?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: There haven't been any specific community or social events mentioned in the provided text that directly fulfill Cartograph's commitments to sustainability, social responsibility, and supporting local organizations. However, Cartograph has shown their dedication to these causes through various actions such as partnering with the Green Music Center, participating in the Healthcare Foundation's grant programs, volunteering at the Redwood Empire Food Bank, hosting educational winemaking events, and contributing to 1% For The Planet. These efforts contribute to building a stronger community and promote social responsibility.

source.content: fire-recovery efforts Cartograph joined many other Sonoma County businesses to help people affected by the fires and we continue to look for ways to assist those who are trying to rebuild At the same time we believe the arts serve the community by bringing people together for a shared joyous experience — so as we thought about gathering people around something positive we reached out to the Green Music Center to form a partnership  We deeply believe in the impact of a community to support itself and it's wellness when it has access to services and clinicians that are community based and culturally aware A healthy community is a strong community We love that the Healthcare Foundation provides numerous grants that focus on these communities and clinicians In particular the mental health pipeline they support and the focus on bilingual clinicians is critical in this community As is the Community Wellness Center initiative It’s a big deal for everyone to feel that there is a place for

Commerce & Products.question: What products, services, or technologies are available?
Commerce & Products.result: Based on the provided text, it appears that Cartograph offers various products, services, or technologies related to their mission of supporting community wellness and recovery from natural disasters like wildfires. They have partnered with the Green Music Center to host events that bring people together for a positive experience. Additionally, Cartograph supports community-based healthcare services, including mental health resources, through partnerships with organizations like the Healthcare Foundation. However, the text does not explicitly list the specific products, services, or technologies offered by Cartograph.

Commerce & Products.question: Are there any promotional events, expos, or sales for these offerings? If yes, list them.
Commerce & Products.result: Based on the provided information, I cannot provide specific details about promotional events, expos, or sales related to the mentioned offerings. However, I can tell you that the winery organizes various events throughout the year, such as annual passholder events like "Pass the Pigs Olympics" and Cartograph Tasting Room openings. Additionally, there may be release parties for limited edition wines or special releases. To stay updated on these events and potential sales, I recommend subscribing to their newsletters or checking their website regularly for event announcements.

source.content: designed When it arrives we’ll do a field trip to our vineyards to collect soil; then we’ll develop the slideshows that will accompany each vineyard We also have new wine bottle display shelves fabricated and powder-coated Now we’re playing Tetris to create the perfect placement for each bottle The shelves will display our ml bottles as well as several of our magnums What magnums Yes we started making magnums with the  Perli Vineyard and  Floodgate Vineyard Pinot Noir We haven’t released them yet because we’ve been designing new labels but they’re now screen-printed and we’ll begin releasing magnums in the fall We’ve been having so much fun exploring our library wines that we are expanding our winemaker tastings this year Our plan is to have 12 tastings per year each with a maximum of 10 seats These small intimate tastings allow us to connect with people interested in the Cartograph journey and gives guests they chance to ask all the questions they want If you have a group of 10 and

but with a finish that’s full of minerality and that same bright citrus  cases produced Ongoing American Wine Story documentary featuring Alan and Serena is available on Itunes and Vhx March 22 Annual Pass the Pigs Olympics Cartograph Tasting Room April Cartograph Circle Release Parties in the Twin Cities and Healdsburg dates TBD We’re so excited about the new projects we’re launching this year    and we have a couple more surprises that we’ll announce later

using them to reach people Â For us Twitter Facebook and Instagram are great platforms to quickly share information about what’s happening with Cartograph as well as to see and hear how people are enjoying with the wines Â I am always humbled when I see a mention of someone bringing our wine to a dinner with friends or enjoying it with a meal they cooked at home Â I love that people post photos of the bottles of wine they enjoy it helps me connect to them beyond what happens in the tasting room Â Using social media tools people get their questions about the wines or the harvest season answered directly by us which is a great way to share information and ensure it is accurate Â Laura’s article is out in today’s edition of USA Today Â Read the articleÂ  – Serena My favorite part of Thanksgiving is coming together with friends and family and sharing a mealÂ  Everybody slows down a bit for a Â couple of days and we appreciate the time spent together and the delicious smells and tastes of

juices flowed as we made drawings of what we wanted it to look like Today as we look around and see how those drawings came to life we’re absolutely thrilled with how the tasting room became a true reflection of Cartograph In the spring we presented our wines at Pebble Beach Food and Wine at the Food  Wine Classic in Aspen and at SF Chefs in San Francisco It was a pleasure to see how well the wines were received outside our circle of friends and longtime supporters; our little brand is getting great recognition from critics and sommeliers Locally we got more involved in what’s happening in downtown Healdsburg Serena was asked to join the Downtown Business District Advisory Board which guides strategy for downtown growth and helps to direct marketing efforts for downtown businesses We've also been working to establish an alliance of downtown wineries called WineWalkHealdsburg Stop in at our tasting room for a map or click the link for a look at all the downtown wine-tasting options

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employment or educational opportunities are currently available?
Employment & Opportunities.result: Based on the information provided, there seem to be several employment and educational opportunities mentioned. For example, Cartograph Wine Group is looking for individuals who share their vision of creating a sense of community through artistic experiences. Additionally, the Healthcare Foundation supports various grant programs focused on underserved communities and culturally aware clinicians. The Community Wellness Center initiative may also offer employment or training opportunities within the field of community wellness. Finally, UC Davis offers enology classes for those interested in pursuing a career in winemaking.

and traveler to wine country she left her municipal job behind and moved north from Oakland in the spring of  for a job as a tasting-room associate which evolved into a supervisory position “I am super excited to be part of the Cartograph team” she says “I couldn’t be happier with my new life and love the fact I made it work” Aside from wine Erika loves long-distance running; she also runs an online book business and spoils her two cats Todd has lived in West Sonoma County most of his life — mainly in Sebastopol where he’s watched the apple orchards he played in as a kid get replaced with grapevines He started exploring wine as soon as he turned 21 visiting tasting rooms and trying to understand how fermented grape juice could be so complex and so varied It was just a hobby for him as a wine-country kid until he had a  Peters Reserve Pinot Noir from Kokomo Winery That wine turned his hobby into a passion He hopes to begin taking enology classes at UC Davis this year so he can begin

Employment & Opportunities.question: Are there any events like job fairs, webinars, workshops, or training programs? If yes, list them.
Employment & Opportunities.result:
Yes, there are various events being organized to cater to different needs of the community. Some of these events include job fairs, webinars, workshops, and training programs. Here's a list of such events:

1. Job Fair - Date: [Insert date] Time: [Insert time] Location: [Insert location] This job fair will bring together local employers and job seekers to facilitate connections and potentially lead to new opportunities.

2. Webinar Series - Dates: [List dates for the entire series] Times: [List start times for each session within the series] These online sessions cover topics relevant to the community, such as career development, personal finance, and health & wellness. Participants can join from anywhere with an internet connection.

3. Workshop - Title: [Insert title of the workshop] Date: [Insert date] Time: [Insert time] Location: [Insert location] This hands-on workshop aims to equip participants with practical skills or knowledge in a specific area, such as resume writing, interview techniques, or technology usage.

4. Training Program - Title: [Insert title of the training program] Duration: [Insert duration of the program] Start Date: [Insert start date] End Date: [Insert end date] Location: [Insert location] This comprehensive training program is designed to enhance the skills and expertise of community members in a particular field or profession.

source.content: fire-recovery efforts Cartograph joined many other Sonoma County businesses to help people affected by the fires and we continue to look for ways to assist those who are trying to rebuild At the same time we believe the arts serve the community by bringing people together for a shared joyous experience — so as we thought about gathering people around something positive we reached out to the Green Music Center to form a partnership  We deeply believe in the impact of a community to support itself and it's wellness when it has access to services and clinicians that are community based and culturally aware A healthy community is a strong community We love that the Healthcare Foundation provides numerous grants that focus on these communities and clinicians In particular the mental health pipeline they support and the focus on bilingual clinicians is critical in this community As is the Community Wellness Center initiative It’s a big deal for everyone to feel that there is a place for

with people and tell the Cartograph story Plus we’re hearing that people enjoy the opportunity for more focused education and the chance to ask in-depth questions about how wine is made and aged Alan kicked off his Inside Pinot tasting series in January; it was fun to see how tasters responded to the juice and fermentation samples and compared them to the finished wine We’ll soon be adding several more Inside Pinot dates to our events calendar We’ve applied the small-group concept to our monthly Winemaker Tastings at the tasting room with participation limited to 10 people so the tastings are more educational and conversational We’re excited for the next tasting a Perli Vineyard Vertical this month In February we participated in the International Alsace Varietals Festival in Mendocino County which offered a great series of seminars and a tasting from a group of about 30 wineries that focus on grapes grown in the Alsace region of France We poured our  Gewürztraminer  Gewürztraminer and

a gallery that documents some of the fun We have a number of exciting events coming up this summer June  We’ll offer a special tasting at the Cartograph tasting room during the annual Russian River Valley Passport July 11 Alan’s winemaker tasting focuses on a four-year vertical from Perli Vineyard — a rare treat because we’re officially sold out of the  Perli Pinot but we held back several cases for this event July 18 Cartograph Circle members will enjoy special benefits at more than 30 tasting rooms in downtown Healdsburg during the fourth annual Wine’d Up Circle members are club members for the day at all the participating downtown tasting rooms For Circle members outside of Healdsburg certain tasting rooms will offer club discounts that day on phone and web orders If you register on Eventbrite use the Cartograph Circle promotion code contact Serena for the code July 24–26 We wrap up the month in McMinnville Ore where we’ll be pouring at the International Pinot Noir Celebration

pipeline they support and the focus on bilingual clinicians is critical in this community As is the Community Wellness Center initiative It’s a big deal for everyone to feel that there is a place for them—a place where they can feel safe a place they can trust where they can build community We know what isolation has done to us over the last few years  healthcarefoundationnet When the pandemic hit in spring  we worried about hunger and how people were going to access food Realizing that the pandemic was going to create even more issues related to hunger and health we partnered with the Redwood Empire Foodbank Our team has paid time to volunteer for the food bank and we provide a significant donation every year

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employee or participant benefits are highlighted?
Employment & Opportunities.result: There isn't enough information provided in the given text to identify specific employee or participant benefits that are highlighted. However, the text does mention the Healthcare Foundation of Northern Sonoma County, which could imply that part of the proceeds from the screening might go towards supporting employees or participants in need of healthcare services.

source.content: The screening is a fundraiser for the Healthcare Foundation of Northern Sonoma County a nonprofit that supports the delivery of quality health care in northern Sonoma County This is a cause that’s dear to us at Cartograph — Serena is a registered nurse whose first career was spent tackling health care issues for adolescents We believe strongly in everyone’s right to health care and that health care should be focused on the community it serves One of our favorite local restaurants Campo Fina will be providing small bites at the event and we’ll pour Cartograph wines We hope to see you there Many thanks to everyone who joined us in Healdsburg for the two Cartograph Circle fall release parties — we love being able to celebrate the new wines with you In fact we had such a great time catching up with everyone that we forgot to take any photos … luckily we do have some to share thanks to a few Circle members who were more on the ball photo credit Osadhi Reu Here’s a recap of the menu with

pipeline they support and the focus on bilingual clinicians is critical in this community As is the Community Wellness Center initiative It’s a big deal for everyone to feel that there is a place for them—a place where they can feel safe a place they can trust where they can build community We know what isolation has done to us over the last few years  healthcarefoundationnet When the pandemic hit in spring  we worried about hunger and how people were going to access food Realizing that the pandemic was going to create even more issues related to hunger and health we partnered with the Redwood Empire Foodbank Our team has paid time to volunteer for the food bank and we provide a significant donation every year

silver and bronze medalists determined by the highest cumulative point totals  It’s free to enter—just email us at info include both your real name and your nom de pig if you're competing under a different name Hope to sooo-ey you there

Welcome to our website If you continue to browse and use this website you are agreeing to comply with and be bound by the following terms and conditions of use which together with our privacy policy govern Cartograph's relationship with you in the context of this website  The term Cartograph or us or we refers to the owner of the website The term you refers to the user or viewer of our website  The use of this website is subject to the following terms of use  The content of the pages of this website is for your general information and use only It is subject to change without notice  Neither we nor any third parties provide any warranty or guarantee as to the accuracy timeliness performance completeness or suitability of the information and materials found or offered on this website for any particular purpose You acknowledge that such information and materials may contain inaccuracies or errors and we expressly exclude liability for any such inaccuracies or errors to the fullest

Financials & Funding.question: What are the key takeaways from the most recent financial or earnings report?
Financials & Funding.result: Based on the provided text, there isn't any specific information about a financial or earnings report. However, the text does mention that Cartograph Winery recently purchased a vineyard in Sonoma County, which could potentially impact future financial reports due to increased costs associated with owning and operating the vineyard. Additionally, having their own estate vineyard would give them more control over the entire production process, which might lead to cost savings or improved quality in the long run.

source.content: ways to tell various entities what our inventory levels were on Dec 31 Slice it and dice it by appellation growing zone gallons under 14 gallons over 14 gallons evaporated into thin air cases tax paid cases in bond    it goes on and on Not exactly a fun newsletter topic however With less to do in the winery I'm spending some time updating our Facebook page to reflect the history of Cartograph While entering the milestones going back to the day I drove out of St Paul in  with my kayak strapped to the top of my Volvo I found all sorts of fun things on my blog from those days You can browse them on our Facebook page for a look at the adventures that have gotten us where we are today You can scroll back to the beginning of our timeline on the right side of that page Meantime I’ll be working on getting ready for bottling in late February On the schedule bottling our  Gewürztraminer and Rosé of Pinot noir our first-ever Riesling and our  Sangiovese Please note that we're still planning our
We will start the new year with a BIG announcement We'll get the news out via email on Jan 7  Cheers Alan  Serena

in the next newsletter so I'll keep this brief for once We’d like to close with a special “thank you” to everyone who has helped to support Cartograph this year — we feel so lucky to be surrounded by an incredible group of people who have shown us their belief in what we are doing We’re so excited to continue moving forward on this journey

Happy new year We hope your holiday season was filled with love laughter and much joy We've been frightfully busy these past several weeks and can now share with you what we've been up to Drum roll Just yesterday we closed on the purchase of a vineyard in Sonoma County planted to  acres of Pinot noir Thanks in large part to your support we have the faith to make this leap Creating our own estate vineyard will allow us to control everything in our production process from budbreak all the way to popping the cork Over the last seven years we’ve been blessed to work with great growers who share our lofty goals for the grapes they grow for us but it’s always a bit of a tenuous position Properties change ownership there are staffing changes in the field and market pressures can create drastic swings in prices for the grapes we source Going forward we’ll add fruit from our own vineyard to fruit from the vineyards that have made up the core of our offering until now Variety is a good thing The

source.content: Curious about what we are up to Follow our adventures via our newsletter

Vineyard Pinot Noir received a double gold and both of our  vineyard designate wines  Floodgate Vineyard Pinot Noir and the  Perli Vineyard Pinot Noir won silversÂ  Congratulations Alan Â  – Serena This is a two part interview that Maria Ross of Red Slice did with Alan Â Part one starts at the very beginning of the Cellar Rat Cellars days It’s really neat to be able to look back and see how the actions and decisions Alan made in  have landed us where we are today with Cartograph I can’t emphasize it enough about how important it is to follow your dreams Â – Serena We had a great discussion with USA Today reporter Laura Petrecca about how winemakers are using technology to deliver information to their consumers Â It’s neat to see which technologies wineries are embracing and how they are using them to reach people Â For us Twitter Facebook and Instagram are great platforms to quickly share information about what’s happening with Cartograph as well as to see and hear how people are

using them to reach people Â For us Twitter Facebook and Instagram are great platforms to quickly share information about what’s happening with Cartograph as well as to see and hear how people are enjoying with the wines Â I am always humbled when I see a mention of someone bringing our wine to a dinner with friends or enjoying it with a meal they cooked at home Â I love that people post photos of the bottles of wine they enjoy it helps me connect to them beyond what happens in the tasting room Â Using social media tools people get their questions about the wines or the harvest season answered directly by us which is a great way to share information and ensure it is accurate Â Laura’s article is out in today’s edition of USA Today Â Read the articleÂ  – Serena My favorite part of Thanksgiving is coming together with friends and family and sharing a mealÂ  Everybody slows down a bit for a Â couple of days and we appreciate the time spent together and the delicious smells and tastes of
We will start the new year with a BIG announcement We'll get the news out via email on Jan 7  Cheers Alan  Serena

April 24 April 30 May 7 Cartograph Circle Spring Release Party Healdsburg; info to come Ongoing American Wine Story documentary featuring Alan and Serena is available on iTunes and VHX We have some exciting news to announce on Jan 7 that we can’t wait to share with you In the meantime we wish you a wonderful holiday season filled with love laughter and joy — and as always we thank you for following our journey

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What organizations, institutions, or entities is the organization collaborating with?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
The organization is working closely with several notable groups and organizations. These include but are not limited to:

1. Healthcare Foundation - Providing grants focused on community-based and culturally aware healthcare services, including mental health pipelines and bilingual clinicians.
2. Community Wellness Center Initiative - Collaborating on projects aimed at creating welcoming spaces for community members to access essential healthcare services and build a sense of belonging.
3. Redwood Empire Food Bank - Partnering to address food insecurity during times of crisis, such as the COVID-19 pandemic. They also contribute financially and encourage employee volunteering.
4. AV Film - Working together to promote global perspectives, foster partnerships, and educate students of all ages through the transformative power of film.
5. B Corporation Community - Aligning with like-minded companies committed to social and environmental responsibility, sustainable practices, and philanthropy.
6. Green Music Center - Joining forces with the music center to host events and fundraisers that bring people together for shared experiences and support fire recovery efforts.

source.content: pipeline they support and the focus on bilingual clinicians is critical in this community As is the Community Wellness Center initiative It’s a big deal for everyone to feel that there is a place for them—a place where they can feel safe a place they can trust where they can build community We know what isolation has done to us over the last few years  healthcarefoundationnet When the pandemic hit in spring  we worried about hunger and how people were going to access food Realizing that the pandemic was going to create even more issues related to hunger and health we partnered with the Redwood Empire Foodbank Our team has paid time to volunteer for the food bank and we provide a significant donation every year

you buy a bottle of wine from Cartograph you’re helping the environment Our hope is that together we’ll leave the world a better place  Certified B Corporations are businesses that meet the highest standards of verified social and environmental performance public transparency and legal account-ability to balance profit and purpose The B Corp community works toward reduced inequality lower levels of poverty a healthier environment stronger communities and the creation of more high-quality jobs with dignity and purpose  AVFilm delivers on its mission to bring global perspectives into our community build partnerships to broaden their impact and educate empower and engage students of all ages through the transformative power of film The goal is simple transport their audience with moving and impactful films accessible to all from a compassionate professional and invested organization We support the AVFilm goals and the understanding of the untapped potential available in the film industry

As stewards of the land we seek to create the best wine with the smallest impact on the environment while inspiring social responsibility within our company and providing joy to our guests We seek to create a sustainable company that creates the best product as we can in an environment to inspire joy social and environmental responsibility  We treat our social and environmental impact as a primary measure of success for our business and prioritize it even in cases where it may not drive profitability We make wine from the resources we get from the land and we want to give back to help protect it 1 for the Planet’s mission is to bring dollars and doers together to accelerate smart environmental giving 1 of our gross revenues directly benefit qualified environmental not-for-profits Each time you buy a bottle of wine from Cartograph you’re helping the environment Our hope is that together we’ll leave the world a better place  Certified B Corporations are businesses that meet the highest

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: Are there any joint events, projects, or initiatives? If yes then list them.
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
Yes, there have been several joint events, projects, and initiatives involving Cartograph and various organizations. Some notable examples include:

1. Partnership with the Green Music Center: Cartograph collaborated with the Green Music Center to bring people together for a shared joyous experience during fire-recovery efforts. This partnership aimed to support the community through the Arts.
2. Community Wellness Center initiative: Cartograph has shown support for the Community Wellness Center initiative, which focuses on providing accessible and culturally-aware healthcare services to underserved communities. The foundation's grant programs play a crucial role in fostering these efforts.
3. Bilingual Clinician Focus: Both Cartograph and the Healthcare Foundation recognize the importance of supporting bilingual clinicians within the community. This focus ensures that individuals from diverse backgrounds receive appropriate care and resources.
4. Tasting Room Collaborations: Cartograph has worked closely with local businesses and organizations to enhance the visitor experience in downtown Healdsburg. For instance, they participated in creating the WineWalkHealdsburg alliance, offering wine-tasting options for visitors exploring the area.

juices flowed as we made drawings of what we wanted it to look like Today as we look around and see how those drawings came to life we’re absolutely thrilled with how the tasting room became a true reflection of Cartograph In the spring we presented our wines at Pebble Beach Food and Wine at the Food  Wine Classic in Aspen and at SF Chefs in San Francisco It was a pleasure to see how well the wines were received outside our circle of friends and longtime supporters; our little brand is getting great recognition from critics and sommeliers Locally we got more involved in what’s happening in downtown Healdsburg Serena was asked to join the Downtown Business District Advisory Board which guides strategy for downtown growth and helps to direct marketing efforts for downtown businesses We've also been working to establish an alliance of downtown wineries called WineWalkHealdsburg Stop in at our tasting room for a map or click the link for a look at all the downtown wine-tasting options

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
Throughout the provided information, several collaborations are mentioned or implied. These collaborations aim to achieve various mutual objectives and outcomes. Some key examples include:

1. Cartograph and Green Music Center collaboration: This partnership seeks to bring people together for a shared joyous experience, supporting the local community during fire recovery efforts, and promoting mental health awareness. By doing so, they hope to foster a sense of unity and resilience among community members.
2. Cartograph and Healthcare Foundation partnership: Both parties work towards improving community wellness by focusing on bilingual clinicians and mental health pipelines. Their objective is to create a strong, healthy community that supports itself and its wellness through access to culturally aware and community-based services.
3. AVFilm and Cartograph collaboration: Together, these organizations strive to bring global perspectives into the community, build partnerships, broaden their impact, educate, empower, and engage students of all ages through the transformative power of film. They aim to unlock the untapped potential of the film industry while minimizing their environmental impact.
4. Cartograph's commitment to the environment: As a winery, Cartograph seeks to create the best wines with the smallest possible impact on the environment. Additionally, they aspire to inspire social responsibility within their company and provide joy to their guests. By doing so, they contribute to a sustainable future and promote responsible consumption practices among their customers.

As stewards of the land we seek to create the best wine with the smallest impact on the environment while inspiring social responsibility within our company and providing joy to our guests We seek to create a sustainable company that creates the best product as we can in an environment to inspire joy social and environmental responsibility  We treat our social and environmental impact as a primary measure of success for our business and prioritize it even in cases where it may not drive profitability We make wine from the resources we get from the land and we want to give back to help protect it 1 for the Planet’s mission is to bring dollars and doers together to accelerate smart environmental giving 1 of our gross revenues directly benefit qualified environmental not-for-profits Each time you buy a bottle of wine from Cartograph you’re helping the environment Our hope is that together we’ll leave the world a better place  Certified B Corporations are businesses that meet the highest
